definition:
See Aisle.

1. An island. [Poetic] Imperial rule of all the seagirt isles. Milton. 2. (Zo√∂l.)  A spot within another of a different color, as upon the wings of some insects.

To cause to become an island, or like an island; to surround or encompass; to island. [Poetic] Isled in sudden seas of light. Tennyson.
